Uses of Class
graphicslib3D.Point3D

  • Packages that use Point3D 
    Package Description
    graphicslib3D  
    graphicslib3D.editors  
    graphicslib3D.light  

    • Uses of Point3D in graphicslib3D

      Methods in graphicslib3D that return Point3D 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point3D Point3D.add(Point3D p2)
      Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the sum of this point's values and the specified point's values.
      Point3D Vertex3D.add(Vertex3D v2)
      Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the sum of this vertex's location values and the specified vertex's location values.
      Point3D Vertex3D.div(double theDivisor)
      Returns a new Point3D which is the result of dividing this vertex's X,Y,Z location values by the given divisor.
      Point3D Point3D.div(double theDivisor)
      Returns a new Point3D which is the result of dividing this point by the given divisor.
      Point3D ControlMesh.elementAt(int row, int col)
      Returns a reference to the point at the specified row and column in the ControlMesh.
      Point3D[][] ControlMesh.getArray()
      Returns a 4x4 array of Point3D objects.
      Point3D CameraSettingsDialog.getCameraLocation()
      Returns a Point3D containing the camera location as currently defined within the CameraDialog.
      Point3D CameraSettingsDialog.getCameraLookAt()
      Returns a Point3D containing the camera "look-at" point as currently defined within the CameraDialog.
      Point3D CameraSettingsDialog.getCameraUp()
      Returns a Point3D containing the camera 'up' direction as currently defined within the CameraDialog.
      Point3D Vertex3D.getLocation()
      Returns a new Point3D object whose location is the same as the location of this Vertex3D.
      Point3D ICamera.getLocation()
      Returns the location of the camera in world coordinate space.
      Point3D Camera.getLocation()
      Returns a Point3D giving the camera's location.
      Point3D Polygon3D.getPlaneCoefficients()
      Returns a new Point3D object whose XYZW values are the same as the ABCD plane coefficient values of this polygon, unless the plane coefficients are undefined (for example because the polygon has fewer than 3 vertices), in which case returns NULL.
      Point3D Point3D.mid(Point3D p2)
      Returns a new Point3D which is the midpoint between this point and the specified point.
      Point3D Vertex3D.mid(Vertex3D v2)
      Returns a new Point3D which is the midpoint between this vertex's location and the specified vertex's location.
      Point3D Point3D.minus(Point3D p2)
      Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the difference between this point's X,Y,Z and the specified point's X,Y,Z.
      Point3D Vertex3D.minus(Vertex3D v2)
      Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the difference between this vertex's X,Y,Z location values and the specified vertex's X,Y,Z location values.
      Point3D Vertex3D.mult(double theMultiplier)
      Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this vertex's X,Y,Z location values by the given multiplier.
      Point3D Point3D.mult(double theMultiplier)
      Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this point by the given multiplier.
      Point3D Point3D.mult(Matrix3D mat)
      Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this point by the given matrix.
      Methods in graphicslib3D with parameters of type Point3D 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point3D Point3D.add(Point3D p2)
      Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the sum of this point's values and the specified point's values.
      void ControlMesh.addElement(Point3D thePoint, int row, int col)
      Replaces an existing point in this ControlMesh.
      void Polygon3D.addVertex(Point3D aPoint3D)
      Uses the specified Point3D to create a new Vertex3D object and adds the Vertex3D to the tail of the vertex list of this Polygon3D.
      double Point3D.distanceTo(Point3D p2)
      Returns a real number that is the distance between this point and the specified point.
      boolean Point3D.equals(Point3D other)
      Returns true if all four elements of this Point3D are equal to the corresponding elements of the specified Point3D; false if one or more elements are not the same.
      void Polygon3D.insertVertex(Point3D aPoint3D)
      Uses the specified Point3D to create a new Vertex3D object and inserts the Vertex3D at the head of the vertex list of this Polygon3D.
      Point3D Point3D.mid(Point3D p2)
      Returns a new Point3D which is the midpoint between this point and the specified point.
      Point3D Point3D.minus(Point3D p2)
      Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the difference between this point's X,Y,Z and the specified point's X,Y,Z.
      void ControlMesh.setArray(Point3D[][] theNewArray)
      Replaces the data in this ControlMesh with the specified array.
      void CameraSettingsDialog.setCameraLocation(Point3D newLocation)
      Sets the camera location value stored in this dialog object to be the specified location.
      void CameraSettingsDialog.setCameraLookAt(Point3D newLookAt)
      Sets the camera look-at value stored in this dialog object to be the specified look-at point.
      void CameraSettingsDialog.setCameraUp(Point3D newUp)
      Sets the camera up-direction value stored in this dialog object to be the specified up direction.
      void CameraSettingsDialog.setDefaultValues(Point3D defaultLocation, Point3D defaultLookAt, Point3D defaultUp)
      Sets the default values for the camera parameters in the dialog to the specified values.
      void Vertex3D.setLocation(Point3D thePoint)
      Sets the location of this Vertex3D object to be the same as the location of the specified Point3D.
      void ICamera.setLocation(Point3D loc)
      Sets the camera's position to the specified world location.
      void Camera.setLocation(Point3D loc)
      Sets the camera's location in world space to the values in the specified Point3D.
      void Polygon3D.setPlaneCoefficients(Point3D newCoeffs)
      Deprecated. 
      Applications should not use this method since there is no way to assure correspondence between plane coefficients and vertex values if the coefficients can be set independently.
      Constructors in graphicslib3D with parameters of type Point3D 
      Constructor and Description
      ControlMesh(Point3D[][] points)
      Creates a control point array from a specified set of points
      Vector3D(Point3D aPoint)
      Creates a new Vector3D implied by the X,Y,Z values of the specified Point3D; that is, a vector from the origin to the specified point.
      Vertex3D(Point3D p)
      Creates a new Vertex3D with the X,Y,Z, and W values specified by the given Point3D.

    • Uses of Point3D in graphicslib3D.editors

      Subclasses of Point3D in graphicslib3D.editors 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BezierPoint
      This class is a helper class supporting the SurfacePatchDialog; it is not intended to be used directly.
      Methods in graphicslib3D.editors that return Point3D 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point3D[][] QuarterPatchDialogPanel.getSurfaceControlPoints()
      Returns the 4x4 array holding the control points defining the quarter-surface (that is, the 16 control points derived from the 4 "profile curve" control points.

      Returns a Point3D giving the position attribute of this PositionalLight.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void PositionalLight.setPosition(Point3D pos)
